botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Ingestion may cause severe discomfort. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Iris may be rhizomatous or bulbous perennials, with narrow leaves and erect stems bearing flowers with 3 large spreading or pendent fall petals, alternating with 3 erect, often smaller, standard petals, in late winter, spring or early summer
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Louisiana Hybrid irises are rhizomatous perennials with beardless flowers 7-20cm across, borne several to each stem in spring and early summer

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in poorly drained, moist to wet, humus rich, acidic soil in full sun or partial shade. Will not tolerate drying out, keep consistently moist
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by division of rhizomes in autumn. See dividing irises
how_to_grow.pruning: Cut back flower stems after flowering and remove dying foliage in autumn
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs and snails
